website_summaries.verdict: The Saucony Hurricane 16 is a lightweight running shoe that delivers a good combination of stability, comfort, and durability. The shoe is reliable enough for long distance runs and daily training. Based on reviews, there were only a few bad experiences from users regarding fit. Overall, the Hurricane 16 was an above average shoe, although it has drawbacks, but still worth recommending.
pros: Some runners mentioned that the shoe is true to its size and width
Many runners liked the lightweight construction of the Saucony Hurricane 16
The shoe offers a great fit and has enough amount of cushioning for long distance runs
The outsole of the shoe is reliable enough, delivering the durable traction while running on varied surfaces
A few mentioned that Hurricane 16 is breathable
cons: Some runners felt that the shoe is too narrow for them

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for the road
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoe. Yep - it's BRIGHT. But I like orange so it's all good. I've been using Saucony for >20 years now. Tried switching away last year and had all kinds of calf issues. I'm back. Love the Hurricane line; good, stable, shoe. 8mm drop seems to be perfect for me. Took the neonness out of the box and wore them the next day on a 25 mile run. No issues. I've gotten ~100 miles on them so far without a problem. I don't anticipate any, but will update the review if anything unexpected happens (other than needing sunglasses when I tie 'em <grin>)
customer_reviews.author: Norm

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are awesome! I'm not a runner
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are awesome! I'm not a runner, too many knee problems, but go on daily 4+ mile walks at a fast pace. I have mild arthritis in my feet and need shoes with good motion control and arch support. These shoes do both extremely well. These replaced my second pair of Brooks Beast. The Brooks shoes are just as supportive, but a little heavier than the Saucony. And more expensive. You won't be disappointed with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: LarryV

customer_reviews.title: Best Running Shoes Ever
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from Overpronation, so these shoes are absolutely perfect. I wear a size 9 though, and I really wished there was a size 8.5 wide, but other than that they're perfect. I've tried minimalist running shoes, but I would have to say that these are the best if you over-pronate and/or are concerned with your knees/injuries.
customer_reviews.author: Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Have 4 other pairs of Hurricane's, all have been amazing. Including this one. Use these for running and walking the dog, they never let me down.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Stability Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I wore a Hurricane 14 and when they were worn out I decided to try some new shoes just to see what else was out there. Tried the Asics GT 2000, a very good shoe, but not quite as comfortable a fit for me, too much of a drop from heel to toe. Then tried the Adidas Supernova Glide, which just didnt have enough support for me. Back to the Hurricane line with the 16 and the support is just hard to match. It doesn't have the soft bounce of the Adidas shoes, but the support is just so good.
customer_reviews.author: Pat-NYC

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Was fitted at my local expert shop for these and found them online nearly 1/2 off. While it's a highly personal fit, I love these shoes. Wore them training for 3 triathlons and loved them. A bit too heavy to race in....but great for training...especially long runs (14mi +).
customer_reviews.author: A. Fetterman

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: My 4th pair. I love them. I walk about 5 miles a day and they hold up well with the poor feet that I have. I use them with the Aetrex Lynco L2220 insole in them and the combination cannot be beat for me. The insole that comes with them is very comfortable, but I need the extra support because of numerous surgeries. I'll buy again if any are left on Amazon in my size.
customer_reviews.author: Btous

customer_reviews.title: Another excellent model in the Saucony Hurricane line
customer_reviews.text: Another excellent model in the Saucony Hurricane line. I put about 20 miles a week on them and they last about 6-8 months for running; then they get transitioned to just casual wear (since the compression protection is not as important).
customer_reviews.author: Nevadaflyboy

customer_reviews.title: These fit just like the hurricane 15s
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about buying shoes online, but I had a pair of hurricane 15s that wore out. I needed a new pair for running. These fit just like the hurricane 15s. I love them just as much as my last pair. I have flat feet and had plantar fasciitis before my last pair of hurricane 15s, so these shoes saved my feet!
customer_reviews.author: D. Sarvis

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for flat feet.
customer_reviews.text: One of the main reasons why I bought the Hurricane 16 shoe, was that it gave me the option of a 2E size which is a bit rare for my size 8.5 feet. Usually, I have to buy the size 9 which renders a bit too much room in the toe box because of the extra length. The fit of the size 8.5 along with the 2E gave me the perfect feel for my flat feet. Love these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kona Warrior

customer_reviews.title: My perfect running shoe
customer_reviews.text: My favorite running shoe I have ever owned. I bought two pair so that I can get a year or two out of them before I have to rebuy a current model that won't be the same... sometimes innovation and change isn't a good thing... I found the perfect shoe in Hurricane 15!
customer_reviews.author: Perceptual

customer_reviews.title: Usually a Good Choice, Not This Time
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the fourth version of this shoe I've owned. They fit well and keep my toe nails intact. However, this last pair was defective. Not sure if it's just mine but the tread on the shoes is coming unglued. Just the bottom layer. Bad glue I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Mick

customer_reviews.title: but then I got the saucony and they pull my feet in for a comfortable run. Normally with new shoes my feet burn ...
customer_reviews.text: I was having too many knee problems, but then I got the saucony and they pull my feet in for a comfortable run. Normally with new shoes my feet burn until the shoe is broke in, not once with these and also asphalt was a huge pain, but not any more.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D Patterson

customer_reviews.title: My third pair! Great shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Exact shoe that I paid fifty dollars more for at my local running shop. I work on my feet all day and have to buy new shoes often. I have some foot issues and for the last 18 months, I've lived in this style and love them.
customer_reviews.author: Wheaten Mama

customer_reviews.title: All I wear
customer_reviews.text: Saucony makes a great product. It seems that they changed the design of the hurricane slightly. Cant put my finger on it but they feel slightly different. The old design was perfect thus 4 stars. Still a very comfortable light shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Independant

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could afford EVERY Saucony model!
customer_reviews.text: I received them today and wore them for about 6 or so hours. The width was just right and the feel was just right. I have never ordered shoes and Sauconys are a brand I prefer to try on since they have a wide range of shoe designs but I made a good choice getting these pairs. No complaints. I decided to order my Saucs' because there is a lack of (even) average customer service nowadays.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Morales

customer_reviews.title: Shoes arrived on time and in good condition. The fit was perfect
customer_reviews.text: Shoes arrived on time and in good condition. The fit was perfect. Company was generous with the shoelaces but I suppose they could be cut in half so a spare set is readily available! Love the shoe and its quality. Would definitely order another pair in the future.
customer_reviews.author: MJD

customer_reviews.title: shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth of the Hurricane and the best running/walking shoe I have ever used. Really great for pronation and overall stability.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan L. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Quick shoes?
customer_reviews.text: When I was looking for new running shoes, someone told me about these and said I would be thrilled with their quickness. I had no idea what this meant but I bought them on the recommendation. Guess what? These shoes ARE quick! Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis DeLisle

customer_reviews.title: Can't be beaten!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I can, but the shoe can't. I have worn Saucony for over 20 years now. The Hurricane 16 is an excellent progression in the series. Pay attention to how they say to size the shoe because it fits just as they say. I have tried many other shoes in addition to my Saucony shoes over the years and never found anything to come close. Good looking show, great support, and comfortable...mile after mile.
customer_reviews.author: K. B. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Bought mutliple pairs
customer_reviews.text: Great walking shoes. I've bought a few pairs. Prefer the darker blue/black model. Fit well with custom orthotics. THE Blue/BLACK MODEL IS THE BEST LOOKING RUNNING SHOES I'VE OWNED, SO WHY DID THEY REPLACE THEM WITH AN UGLIER NEW MODEL?
customer_reviews.author: MarkFromWilmington

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Continues To Prove They Make Best Running Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Best running shoe without a doubt. Saucony continues to improve with each Hurricane generation. I've been a fan for the last 6 years and will not switch. Great cushioning, support, balance and fit. Durability equally great -- typically run 20-25 miles a week.
customer_reviews.author: msergio04

customer_reviews.title: ... have used these shoes for many years and have enjoyed them, however and there is always a but ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used these shoes for many years and have enjoyed them, however and there is always a but in these they are not holding up like they were in the passed. Do not know if they changed materials or glue just not getting the distance and wear I used to.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Stuck with this after two pairs of 14s
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of 14s at a running store with some assistance for fit and trying a few others. I bought another pair just after the 15s came out, and now I've bought this pair of 16s. Still happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Aerocraft67

customer_reviews.title: Love these those
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. I only bought orange because they were the lowest price color option, but I actually really like them. Great support in these shoes for a runner.
customer_reviews.author: P. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I buy these shoes for my high school cross country ...
customer_reviews.text: I buy these shoes for my high school cross country runner for training. He can get a lot of miles on them (about 550-600). He's been wearing Hurricanes for two years and has been injury-free. Most of his teammates switch out shoes by 400 miles. The extra mileage is definitely worth the extra expense but finding them on Amazon for the price of a cheaper trainer was a win.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe but miss the tongue pocket
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoe and comparable to the 14 (did not try the 15). Thanks to the previous reviews/tips for advising on the larger size, bought 1/2 a size smaller and they are perfect fit. My only complaint with this model is that the tongue does not have a pocket to fit a key or pod as did the 14, which I find very frustrating. Why remove such a useful feature? Otherwise I am very satisfied and will continue to run in this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Sandro Calavalle

customer_reviews.title: I like the fit and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I like the fit and comfort. These are appropriate for long distance running. Inner colors bleeded onto my socks. Otherwise I would have given 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: RON

customer_reviews.title: Hurricane's have been my go-to running shoe. Having wider ...
customer_reviews.text: Hurricane's have been my go-to running shoe. Having wider feet, I usually wear men's running shoes and these have offered the support necessary for my running form.
customer_reviews.author: Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband's favorite. He heard they were going to discontinue this one, so we stocked up.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R. Travis

customer_reviews.title: Loved the shoes but they had to be broken in ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved the shoes but they had to be broken in for a couple of days, but after the blister on my heal went away I tried them again and the were fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: These shoes provide great support for the very long long Saturday runs (16
customer_reviews.text: These shoes provide great support for the very long long Saturday runs (16, 18, 20, 18, 22 miles and counting). At the time of writing this review, I did over 100 miles in them and will joining me in my next Reggae Marathon - Negril, Jamaica (Dec 6th, 2014). Wanted an amazing color but I guess with my size, I have to settle for what is available.
customer_reviews.author: FhF

customer_reviews.title: great for distance runners working on form
customer_reviews.text: Tons of cushioning, great for distance runners working on form, pace, and endurance or if your gonna be on your feet for awhile, this shoe is definitely the way to go because it provides good support. However, I would not recommend if your focus is speed and sprinting.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Frausto

customer_reviews.title: Not for medium to high arches
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't like the way these shoes supported my foot. Both the heel and overall cushioning felt great, but for a stability shoe, my arches still felt quite unsupported.
customer_reviews.author: Woka

customer_reviews.title: Love this shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love this shoe! I wore out my first pair, tried on this year's ISO Hurricane and a few others, but came back to the 16s. In fact I bought 2 pair, 1 for work and 1 for home. I run 10-20 miles per week.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Curto

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for my husband and it fit perfectly. ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my husband and it fit perfectly. This is actually his 2nd pair of Hurricane 16 he got. Per his word, "it is very comfortable".
customer_reviews.author: Kit

customer_reviews.title: Good running ahow
customer_reviews.text: Love the old Hurricane. Not sure why the company would change this classic so dramatically.
customer_reviews.author: Steven E

customer_reviews.title: Saucony running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable shoe I have owned. Not much of a selection for Saucony where I live so Amazon Prime is a life saver. Best shoe I have been in for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: don weber

customer_reviews.title: Good running shoe with support and comfort
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight shoe with plenty of support and traction. Fabric and even shoe laces flex with your foot making for a very comfortable fit.
customer_reviews.author: happy customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm heavy person with knee problems and this shoes are very helpful for me.

customer_reviews.title: Why discontinue a great shoe?
customer_reviews.text: My favorite shoe. So of course it is discontinued. I was lucky to get this old stock pair, the last ones.
customer_reviews.author: Harold B. Vance

customer_reviews.title: My 3rd set of Hurricane's
customer_reviews.text: Always a winner and the 16 is no different from the older versions in regards to comfort and style. It fits as expected.
customer_reviews.author: I buy Stuff

customer_reviews.title: I like the shoes in general
customer_reviews.text: I like the shoes in general. I have wide feet naturally so they dont fit perfectly but I didnt want to spend the extra money to get the wider size. When I ordered them I wasnt a huge fan of the color but again came down to the price. But when I took them out of the box and got to see them for real I actually like the look.

customer_reviews.title: Run Small
customer_reviews.text: They run small. Had to reorder to step up the size, but now they feel great!
customer_reviews.author: K.Waggner

customer_reviews.title: These were as good as the Asics Kayano 21s but the only thing ...
customer_reviews.text: These were as good as the Asics Kayano 21s but the only thing is the orange color was not the orange I expected from the picture. Neutral colors would be nice or more choices would be better.

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Hurricane 15
customer_reviews.text: I use to have the hurricane 15 and they were good, these shoes are much better..

customer_reviews.title: to my opinion the most comfortable out of the box and very durable
customer_reviews.text: second pair I purchased. to my opinion the most comfortable out of the box and very durable.

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe without adding additional orthotics
customer_reviews.text: Shoe was brought to my attention by a nurse at my podiatrist. I had plantar fasciitis and eventually tore my fascia. These shoes offer great support and I have no problem walking in them now that i am healed.

customer_reviews.title: super nice
customer_reviews.text: top 5 sneaker in my life that has multiple broken ankles and feet.

customer_reviews.title: now i have the iso and they are great.
customer_reviews.text: i went from hurricane 15 to this model. after just a few runs i had pain in my ankle. there is a different in the drop from the 15 to the 16. now i have the iso and they are great.

customer_reviews.title: Snug and comfy shoes...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable - forgot I was wearing new shoes during the first run in them...! The new lacing is a bit fiddly to start with, but with adjustment I ended up with a very comfortable fit...

customer_reviews.title: Nice running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I only wear these to run. I started wearing Saucony's with the Hurricane 14 and later upgraded to the Hurricane 15. Thought I'd try the 16's this year. So far so good.

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Best running shoe for heavy runner, I had the hurricane 14 then I tried Asics Gel Nimbus 15. Believe me Saucony Hurricane are best by far

customer_reviews.text: I found the fit to be different than the 15s. I felt pressure on my arch area, so I sent them back.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband thought it was the best running shoe so far.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are great for jogging or playing the odd same of ball.

customer_reviews.title: These are my favorite shoes, I Don't know why they have to ...
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite shoes, I Don't know why they have to keep making changes, the ISO/Hurricane 17's just don't fit as well, and I can't run as fast as I do in the Hurricane 16's.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Brengman

customer_reviews.title: Sticking with the Hurricane classic model
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I have been loyal to this model of the Hurricane since version 10 came out. I tried the new Hurricane ISO model but I don't care for the fit of the shoe. The toe box is too wide for my foot in size D and the heel does not feel as secure as the classic models. I will likely switch brands once I no longer can locate Hurricane 16s or 15s in my size.

customer_reviews.title: Saucony is the way to go
customer_reviews.text: My husband is an avid runner. He likes the way the Saucony fits and gets a quality shoe for a quality price.

customer_reviews.title: Great sneaker Great Fit and truly light weight
customer_reviews.text: Super light weight, comfortable without any need to allow for "breaking in"

customer_reviews.title: Great support
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. They were recommended to me by my P.T. 3 1/2 years ago after major Achilles Tendon surgery. So comfortable and supportive. This is my 6th pair.

customer_reviews.title: Tearing on top
customer_reviews.text: Between two and three stars. I may have walked 100-200 miles in them. They are tearing up at the top where I put my foot in, both shoes. I'm surprised, because the rest of the shoe is in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great Running Shoes
customer_reviews.text: The Saucony Hurricanes are my favorite running shoe and have been for many years.

customer_reviews.title: Fit Like a Glove
customer_reviews.text: I have always found Saucony grid shoes to be exceptional running shoes. The Hurricane 16 fit like a glove right out of the box.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my third pair after a couple of years. These are my favorite running shoes and have helped me through various long distance relays, half marathons, and are currently my training shoes for a full.

customer_reviews.title: This is like my 18th pair since 2010
customer_reviews.text: This is like my 18th pair since 2010. As a track athlete it's important to find your shoe and I do feel that this is my shoe. I slip in my orthodics and then this is really the only shoe I wear.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Have been using the 15 and this new one is as good or better for runners with flat arches and over pronators.

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of hurricanes and they are running small... Bummer!

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well. Takes some time to get used to. It is a true 15 (I am an 14.5)

customer_reviews.title: Love the Brand
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several Saucony Hurricanes and have always been pleased with the performance.

customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing the Hurricane shoe since they were the Hurricane 9 and have loved them!

customer_reviews.title: I take 10. 5 most of the time. ...
customer_reviews.text: I take 10.5 most of the time.I order a size bigger and. They were barely big anough.proubly next time get wider.

customer_reviews.title: These are the only shoes that are comfortable to me
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this line of running shoe for years. I have foot problems. These are the only shoes that are comfortable to me.

customer_reviews.text: Good stability shoes. 6mi run right out of the box. No issues.

customer_reviews.text: I've used Hurrinanes for around 4 years and these 16s are as good as ever - comfortable and stable shoes.

customer_reviews.title: Third pair and counting
customer_reviews.text: Third pair of Hurricanes that I have owned and they do not disappoint. Will continue to buy this line in the future

customer_reviews.title: Very pedded!
customer_reviews.text: Its a good running shoes to training. Save your knees!

customer_reviews.text: Fits good for length but the width of the 2E is not quite wide enough for me. Nice light weight shoe.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding and durable. I had an older version of this shoe for 2 years.

customer_reviews.text: Back goes up higher than the 15 and tends to rub more

customer_reviews.text: It fits as indicated. I ordered a 12.5 knowing im a 12. Fits me loose bu as expected.

customer_reviews.text: They are comfortable and great for walking. They are a little chilly in the fall because they are so breathable. Love them so far.

customer_reviews.text: Fits as it did in the store and great to run with. Provide the extra support I need so my ankles don't roll in and has helped my running.

product_meta.title: Saucony Hurricane 16 Running Shoes - 11 Grey
product_meta.description: The Hurricane 16 takes premium stability and cushioning to another level with a full length PowerGrid and Dual Density SSL EVA for a more efficient transition through the gait cycle. Upper A revolution in upper construction, the Hurricane 16 features intelligent upper engineering, incorporating 'Sauc'Fit' within the design specification. A unique fit system fused within the upper locks the midfoot onto the platform, whilst simultaneously keeping the heel secure and comfortable. Teamed with a HydraMax Collar Lining, a plush hand feel combined with excellent moisture-wicking properties creates a supreme duo. Midsole Creating a truly unique feel and experience Saucony have re engineered their PowerGrid technology, creating PWRGRID+. By adding a Powerfoam material and integrating it with GRID technology, Saucony have created a system that effectively centres the foot, absorbs impact and distributes pressure. The PWRGRID+ platform’s increased stack heights deliver over 20% more cushioning and 15% more resiliency than the previous version, increasing versatility and prolonging the longevity of the shoes capabilities. Working in concert with the re-engineered PWRGRID+ technology, SRC impact zone provides durable shock absorption at impact, creating a smoother transition from heel to toe. Outsole The traditional shank has been removed to save weight, replaced with foam for a cleaner transition. Complimenting the outsole design iBR+ is a supremely lightweight (33% more lightweight), yet highly durable outsole rubber that enhances the already formidable cushioning capabilities of the shoe. Completing the shoe XT-900 has been moulded to the outsole, offering exceptional traction capabilities and high wear properties. The 16th edition features new updates all centred around improving running efficiency and comfort. Designed especially for the over-pronator, re-align your run in the Hurricane 16s.
feature_bullets: **NEW** Flex Groove - Added to the medial forefoot pod, the flex groove provides a more flexible and natural running motion, allowing your foot to move freely.
**UPDATED** Fully Reflective Material in Heel Window - Providing 500 cd/luxm2, the reflective elements ensure you remain visible in low light conditions.
**UPDATED** Redesigned Support Frame - Designed to improve fit by locking the heel securely and making your run more stable.
**UPDATED** More Durable Mesh Upper - Helps keep your feet cool and gives you a perfect fit.
Luxurious HydraMax Collar Lining - This is great for next-to-skin comfort and provides maximum wicking properties to help keep your feet cool and dry.
